   "cell_type": "markdown",

   "source": [
    "# Lineare Regression am Beispiel Diamanten-Datensatz"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "e1b42314-0909-4650-9032-7d387c7467bf",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import seaborn as sns\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "37b171ba-ccc7-46cd-a406-a7c50e71b6e3",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## About Dataset\n",
    "### Context\n",
    "\n",
    "This classic dataset contains the prices and other attributes of almost 54,000 diamonds. It's a great dataset for beginners learning to work with data analysis and visualization.\n",
    "### Content\n",
    "\n",
    "- **price** price in US dollars (\\$326--\\$18,823)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **carat** weight of the diamond (0.2--5.01)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **cut** quality of the cut (Fair, Good, Very Good, Premium, Ideal)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **color** diamond colour, from J (worst) to D (best)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **clarity** a measurement of how clear the diamond is (I1 (worst), SI2, SI1, VS2, VS1, VVS2, VVS1, IF (best))\n",
    "\n",
    "- **x** length in mm (0--10.74)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **y** width in mm (0--58.9)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **z** depth in mm (0--31.8)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **depth** total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43--79)\n",
    "\n",
    "- **table** width of top of diamond relative to widest point (43--95)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "a825c712-76d9-4a2a-a0d0-e4ad14acd4bc",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "(53940, 10)\n"
     ]
    },

     "data": {

       "      <td>4.07</td>\n",
       "      <td>2.31</td>\n",
       "    </tr>\n",
       "    <tr>\n",
       "      <th>3</th>\n",
       "      <td>0.29</td>\n",
       "      <td>Premium</td>\n",
       "      <td>I</td>\n",
       "      <td>VS2</td>\n",
       "      <td>62.4</td>\n",
       "      <td>58.0</td>\n",
       "      <td>334</td>\n",
       "      <td>4.20</td>\n",
       "      <td>4.23</td>\n",

       "      <td>Good</td>\n",

       "      <td>SI2</td>\n",
       "      <td>63.3</td>\n",
       "      <td>58.0</td>\n",
       "      <td>335</td>\n",
       "      <td>4.34</td>\n",

       "</div>"

      "text/plain": [
       "   carat      cut color clarity  depth  table  price     x     y     z\n",

       "1   0.21  Premium     E     SI1   59.8   61.0    326  3.89  3.84  2.31\n",

    "df.head()"

    "tmp_df=df.sample(100)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.scatter(x = tmp_df[\"carat\"], y = tmp_df[\"price\"])\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]

    "## Funktion zur Berechnung des Preises"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "3217af51-6528-4bd2-8358-8a1cd55a66f6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Preis berechnen\n",
    "\n",
    "y=kx+d"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "663690d3-6154-442e-a86a-8eda2824b0d3",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Funktion"
   ]
  },

    "## Mit Modell Preis für fiktive Diamanten vorhersagen"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 26,
   "id": "a8775dfe-7d3f-410a-8243-2cd4d4bf0da4",

   "source": [
    "## Gerade ausgeben\n",
    "Wie benötigen 2 Punkte, um die gelernte Gerade konstruieren zu können."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 46,
   "id": "5c73fbd8-d27d-4c95-b9fd-fcd9e2e37484",

   ]

   ],
   "source": [
    "x = np.array([4, 0])\n",
    "\n",
    "y_pred = model.predict(x.reshape(-1, 1))\n",
    "print(y_pred)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(x, y_pred, color=\"red\", label=\"Regressionslinie\")\n",
    "plt.scatter(x = tmp_df[\"carat\"], y = tmp_df[\"price\"])\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "3369c678-d548-46f0-bbd2-0e62bfe38dbb",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Warum quadriert?\n",
    "\n",
    "Die lineare Regression versucht, jeden Punkt so gut wie möglich zu beschreiben. Ein größerer Abstand wird mehr abgestraft, als immer nur ein bisschen danaben zu liegen."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 77,
   "id": "dfa8da3d-3bbf-4831-943a-fc0300c2d951",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "line_y = 3\n",
    "#line_y = 4\n",
    "\n",
    "xs = [1, 2, 3, 4]\n",
    "ys = [1, 5, 5, 1]\n",
    "\n",
    "# Punktwolke\n",
    "plt.scatter(xs, ys)  \n",
    "\n",
    "# Horizontale Linie\n",
    "plt.plot([0, 5], [line_y, line_y], color='red')\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.yticks(np.arange(0, 7, 1))\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"x\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"y\")\n",
    "plt.grid(True)\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "d578aa8e-cf74-449f-a946-18e8a54f8c7d",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# wenn line_y = 3, dann E = 16 => das ist dann die beste Gerade! Lineare Regression würde dann bei line_y=3 stoppen!\n",
    "# wenn line_y = 4, dann E = 20"
   ]
  }
